name: run
bannerDescription: Executes a viash component from the provided viash config file. viash generates a temporary executable and immediately executes it with the given parameters.
bannerUsage: viash run config.vsh.yaml [-p docker] [-k true/false]  -- [arguments for script]
footer:
-- param1 param2 ...    Extra parameters to be passed to the component itself.
                          -- is used to separate viash arguments from the arguments
                          of the component.

The temporary directory can be altered by setting the VIASH_TEMP directory. Example:
  export VIASH_TEMP=/home/myuser/.viash_temp
  viash run config.vsh.yaml

opts.name: platform
opts.descr: Specifies which platform amongst those specified in the config to use. If this is not provided, the first platform will be used. If no platforms are defined in the config, the native platform will be used. In addition, the path to a platform yaml file can also be specified.

opts.name: config
opts.descr: A viash config file (example: config.vsh.yaml). This argument can also be a script with the config as a header.

opts.name: config_mod
opts.descr: Modify a viash config at runtime using @[dynamic config modding](config_mod).

opts.name: keep
opts.descr: Whether or not to keep temporary files. By default, files will be deleted if all goes well but remain when an error occurs. By specifying --keep true, the temporary files will always be retained, whereas --keep false will always delete them. The temporary directory can be overwritten by setting defining a VIASH_TEMP directory.

opts.name: cpus
opts.descr: The maximum number of (logical) cpus a component is allowed to use.

opts.name: memory
opts.descr: The maximum amount of memory a component is allowed to allocate. Unit must be one of B, KB, MB, GB, TB or PB.

name: build
bannerDescription: Build an executable from the provided viash config file.

opts.name: platform
opts.descr: Specifies which platform amongst those specified in the config to use. If this is not provided, the first platform will be used. If no platforms are defined in the config, the native platform will be used. In addition, the path to a platform yaml file can also be specified.

opts.name: config
opts.descr: A viash config file (example: config.vsh.yaml). This argument can also be a script with the config as a header.

opts.name: config_mod
opts.descr: Modify a viash config at runtime using @[dynamic config modding](config_mod).

opts.name: output
opts.descr: Path to directory in which the executable and any resources is built to. Default: "output/".

opts.name: setup
opts.descr: Which @[setup strategy](docker_setup_strategy) for creating the container to use [Docker Platform only].

opts.name: push
opts.descr: Whether or not to push the container to a Docker registry [Docker Platform only].

name: test
bannerDescription: Test the component using the tests defined in the viash config file.
bannerUsage: viash test config.vsh.yaml [-p docker] [-k true/false] [--setup cachedbuild]
footer:
The temporary directory can be altered by setting the VIASH_TEMP directory. Example:
  export VIASH_TEMP=/home/myuser/.viash_temp
  viash run meta.vsh.yaml

opts.name: platform

opts.name: config
opts.descr: A viash config file (example: config.vsh.yaml). This argument can also be a script with the config as a header.

opts.name: config_mod
opts.descr: Modify a viash config at runtime using @[dynamic config modding](config_mod).

opts.name: keep
opts.descr: Whether or not to keep temporary files. By default, files will be deleted if all goes well but remain when an error occurs. By specifying --keep true, the temporary files will always be retained, whereas --keep false will always delete them. The temporary directory can be overwritten by setting defining a VIASH_TEMP directory.

opts.name: cpus
opts.descr: The maximum number of (logical) cpus a component is allowed to use.

opts.name: memory
opts.descr: The maximum amount of memory a component is allowed to allocate. Unit must be one of B, KB, MB, GB, TB or PB.

opts.name: setup
opts.descr: Which @[setup strategy](docker_setup_strategy) for creating the container to use [Docker Platform only].

subcommands.name: build
subcommands.bannerDescription: Build a namespace from many viash config files.
subcommands.bannerUsage: viash ns build [-n nmspc] [-s src] [-t target] [-p docker] [--setup] [--push] [--parallel] [--flatten]

opts.name: query
opts.descr: Filter which components get selected by component and @[namespace](namespace) name. Can be a regex. Example: "^mynamespace/component1$".

opts.name: query_namespace
opts.descr: Filter which namespaces get selected by @[namespace](namespace) name. Can be a regex. Example: "^mynamespace$".

opts.name: query_name
opts.descr: Filter which components get selected by component name. Can be a regex. Example: "^component1".

opts.name: src
opts.descr: A source directory containing viash config files, possibly structured in a hierarchical folder structure. Default: src/.

opts.name: platform
opts.descr: Acts as a regular expression to filter the platform ids specified in the found config files. If this is not provided, all platforms will be used. If no platforms are defined in a config, the native platform will be used. In addition, the path to a platform yaml file can also be specified.

opts.name: parallel
opts.descr: Whether or not to run the process in parallel.

opts.name: config_mod
opts.descr: Modify a viash config at runtime using @[dynamic config modding](config_mod).

opts.name: target
opts.descr: A target directory to build the executables into. Default: target/.

opts.name: setup
opts.descr: Which @[setup strategy](docker_setup_strategy) for creating the container to use [Docker Platform only].

opts.name: push
opts.descr: Whether or not to push the container to a Docker registry [Docker Platform only].

opts.name: flatten
opts.descr: Flatten the target builds, handy for building one platform to a bin directory.

subcommands.name: test
subcommands.bannerDescription: Test a namespace containing many viash config files.
subcommands.bannerUsage: viash ns test [-n nmspc] [-s src] [-p docker] [--parallel] [--tsv file.tsv] [--setup cachedbuild] [--append]

opts.name: query
opts.descr: Filter which components get selected by component and @[namespace](namespace) name. Can be a regex. Example: "^mynamespace/component1$".

opts.name: query_namespace
opts.descr: Filter which namespaces get selected by @[namespace](namespace) name. Can be a regex. Example: "^mynamespace$".

opts.name: query_name
opts.descr: Filter which components get selected by component name. Can be a regex. Example: "^component1".

opts.name: src
opts.descr: A source directory containing viash config files, possibly structured in a hierarchical folder structure. Default: src/.

opts.name: platform
opts.descr: Acts as a regular expression to filter the platform ids specified in the found config files. If this is not provided, all platforms will be used. If no platforms are defined in a config, the native platform will be used. In addition, the path to a platform yaml file can also be specified.

opts.name: parallel
opts.descr: Whether or not to run the process in parallel.

opts.name: config_mod
opts.descr: Modify a viash config at runtime using @[dynamic config modding](config_mod).

opts.name: keep
opts.descr: Whether or not to keep temporary files. By default, files will be deleted if all goes well but remain when an error occurs. By specifying --keep true, the temporary files will always be retained, whereas --keep false will always delete them. The temporary directory can be overwritten by setting defining a VIASH_TEMP directory.

opts.name: cpus
opts.descr: The maximum number of (logical) cpus a component is allowed to use.

opts.name: memory
opts.descr: The maximum amount of memory a component is allowed to allocate. Unit must be one of B, KB, MB, GB, TB or PB.

opts.name: setup
opts.descr: Which @[setup strategy](docker_setup_strategy) for creating the container to use [Docker Platform only].

opts.name: tsv
opts.descr: Path to write a summary of the test results to.

opts.name: append
opts.descr: Append to tsv instead of overwrite

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.bannerDescription: List a namespace containing many viash config files.
subcommands.bannerUsage: viash ns list [-n nmspc] [-s src] [-p docker]

opts.name: query
opts.descr: Filter which components get selected by component and @[namespace](namespace) name. Can be a regex. Example: "^mynamespace/component1$".

opts.name: query_namespace
opts.descr: Filter which namespaces get selected by @[namespace](namespace) name. Can be a regex. Example: "^mynamespace$".

opts.name: query_name
opts.descr: Filter which components get selected by component name. Can be a regex. Example: "^component1".

opts.name: src
opts.descr: A source directory containing viash config files, possibly structured in a hierarchical folder structure. Default: src/.

opts.name: platform
opts.descr: Acts as a regular expression to filter the platform ids specified in the found config files. If this is not provided, all platforms will be used. If no platforms are defined in a config, the native platform will be used. In addition, the path to a platform yaml file can also be specified.

opts.name: parallel
opts.descr: Whether or not to run the process in parallel.

opts.name: config_mod
opts.descr: Modify a viash config at runtime using @[dynamic config modding](config_mod).

opts.name: format
opts.descr: Which output format to use.

opts.name: parse_argument_groups
opts.descr: Whether or not to postprocess each component's @[argument groups](argument_groups).

subcommands.name: exec
subcommands.bannerDescription:
Execute a command for all found Viash components.
The syntax of this command is inspired by `find . -exec echo {} \;`.

The following fields are automatically replaced:  

 * `{}` | `{path}`: path to the config file
 * `{abs-path}`: absolute path to the config file
 * `{dir}`: path to the parent directory of the config file
 * `{abs-dir}`: absolute path to the directory of the config file
 * `{main-script}`: path to the main script (if any)
 * `{abs-main-script}`: absolute path to the main script (if any)
 * `{functionality-name}`: name of the component
 * `{namespace}`: namespace of the component
 * `{platform}`: selected platform id (only when --apply_platform is used)
 * `{output}`: path to the destination directory when building the component
 * `{abs-output}`: absolute path to the destination directory when building the component

A command suffixed by `\;` (or nothing) will execute one command for each
of the Viash components, whereas a command suffixed by `+` will execute one
command for all Viash components.
subcommands.bannerUsage:
viash ns exec 'echo {path} \\;'
viash ns exec 'chmod +x {main-script} +'

opts.name: query
opts.descr: Filter which components get selected by component and @[namespace](namespace) name. Can be a regex. Example: "^mynamespace/component1$".

opts.name: query_namespace
opts.descr: Filter which namespaces get selected by @[namespace](namespace) name. Can be a regex. Example: "^mynamespace$".

opts.name: query_name
opts.descr: Filter which components get selected by component name. Can be a regex. Example: "^component1".

opts.name: src
opts.descr: A source directory containing viash config files, possibly structured in a hierarchical folder structure. Default: src/.

opts.name: platform
opts.descr: Acts as a regular expression to filter the platform ids specified in the found config files. If this is not provided, all platforms will be used. If no platforms are defined in a config, the native platform will be used. In addition, the path to a platform yaml file can also be specified.

opts.name: parallel
opts.descr: Whether or not to run the process in parallel.

opts.name: config_mod
opts.descr: Modify a viash config at runtime using @[dynamic config modding](config_mod).

opts.name: apply_platform
opts.descr:
Fills in the {platform} and {output} field by applying each platform to the 
config separately. Note that this results in the provided command being applied
once for every platform that matches the --platform regex.

opts.name: dry_run
opts.descr: Perform a dry run.

opts.name: cmd
opts.descr: The command to execute for each viash config file in the namespace.

subcommands.name: view
subcommands.bannerDescription: View the config file after parsing.

opts.name: platform
opts.descr: Specifies which platform amongst those specified in the config to use. If this is not provided, the first platform will be used. If no platforms are defined in the config, the native platform will be used. In addition, the path to a platform yaml file can also be specified.

opts.name: config
opts.descr: A viash config file (example: config.vsh.yaml). This argument can also be a script with the config as a header.

opts.name: config_mod
opts.descr: Modify a viash config at runtime using @[dynamic config modding](config_mod).

opts.name: format
opts.descr: Which output format to use.

opts.name: parse_argument_groups
opts.descr: Whether or not to postprocess each component's @[argument groups](argument_groups).

subcommands.name: inject
subcommands.bannerDescription: Inject a Viash header into the main script of a Viash component.
